--- title: Strong Interactions need Strong Machines subtitle: The Lattice QCD approach format: metropolis-beamer-revealjs: theme: style.scss header-logo: slide-number: "c" author: - name: Roberto Dionisio email: roberto.dionisio@phd.unipi.it affiliations: Università di Pisa date: last-modified embed-resources: false --- ## The Standard Model ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:1.2em; font-weight:300; margin-top:40px;"} The most successful theory (so far) of **fundamental interactions** ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; margin-top:30px;"} **Gauge principle:**
Interactions arise by requiring invariance under local symmetry transformations. ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; margin-top:10px; text-align:left"} - **Electromagnetic** → $\mathrm{U}(1)_{\text{em}}$
acts on charged particles - **Weak** → $\mathrm{SU}(2)_L$
responsable of radioactive decays - **Strong** → $\mathrm{SU}(3)_C$
binds quarks inside hadrons ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; margin-top:10px;"} $$\mathcal{L}_{\text{SM}} \;=\; \mathcal{L}_{\text{gauge}} + \mathcal{L}_{\text{matter}} + \mathcal{L}_{\text{Higgs}}$$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:0.9em; font-style:italic; color:gray; margin-top:70px; text-align: right; "} Gravity unfortunately is not included in the Standard Model. ::: ## The Strong Interaction {auto-animate=true auto-animate-easing="ease"} ::: {class="fragment" style="position:absolute; left:230px; top:20px; justify-content:center; font-size:1.3em; font-weight:300;"} Matter content: ::: ::: {.r-vstack} ::: {.r-hstack} ::: {data-id="up" class="fragment zoom-in" style="position:absolute; left:50px; top:100px; background:#d72638; width:160px; height:160px; border-radius:50%; display:flex; align-items:center; justify-content:center; color:white; font-weight:450; text-align:center;"} u

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
